util.spring.io

Class FifoResource<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.spring.io.FifoResource<T>

  • public abstract class FifoResource<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Converts resource data into objects using a "first-available" strategy to determine from which location to load resource data with an option to fall back to a predefined stream of objects if no resource data can be fetched from the specified resource locations. The functionality is provided by the read template method. Subclasses have to fill in a resource loader and a resource reader to convert resource data into objects; optionally a subclass may provide fall-back objects.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      FifoResource() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected abstract ResourceReader<T> getConverter()
      Subclasses implement this method to provide a ResourceReader to convert resource data when reading data in.
      java.util.stream.Stream<T> getFallback()
      Subclasses may override this method to provide objects that the read method will return if no resource data can be found in all of the specified resource locations.
      protected abstract org.springframework.core.io.ResourceLoader getResourceLoader()
      Subclasses implement this method to provide a ResourceLoader to access resources when reading configuration in.
      java.util.stream.Stream<T> read(ResourceLocation... loci)
      Reads objects from the first resource available out of the specified locations, optionally falling back to a given stream of objects if no resource is available.

      • getResourceLoader

        protected abstract org.springframework.core.io.ResourceLoader getResourceLoader()
        Subclasses implement this method to provide a ResourceLoader to access resources when reading configuration in.
        Returns:
        the resource loader to use.

      • getConverter

        protected abstract ResourceReader<T> getConverter()
        Subclasses implement this method to provide a ResourceReader to convert resource data when reading data in.
        Returns:
        the resource reader to use.

      • getFallback

        public java.util.stream.Stream<T> getFallback()
        Subclasses may override this method to provide objects that the read method will return if no resource data can be found in all of the specified resource locations.
        Returns:
        the fall-back objects to use.

      • read

        public java.util.stream.Stream<T> read(ResourceLocation... loci)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads objects from the first resource available out of the specified locations, optionally falling back to a given stream of objects if no resource is available.
        Parameters:
        loci - where to look for resources.
        Returns:
        the items read from the first available resource or the fall-back items (if provided) as the case may be. The returned stream may be empty (e.g. the resource stream holds no data, no fall-back items provided) but will never be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurred while reading resource data.
